div.p: To Aniketos, epistatês of Euhemeria, from [ --- ], daughter of Petosiris, of those from the same village. On the 21st of Mecheir, year 39, Tnephersoïs, daughter of Kephalon, her daughters Daphnis and Zenbagis, and her sons, whose names I do not know, started an argument with me for reasons I do not understand, and attacking me… and… while many people were present, whom I called to witness. I ask that you send…. (J. Bauschatz, Law and Enforcement, pp273–274)
